sen.j: 太秦天神川駅（うずまさてんじんがわえき）は、京都府京都市右京区にある、京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄東西線の終着駅で、同区にできた初の地下鉄駅である。
sen.e: Located in the Ukyo Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, the Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station is the last stop on the Tozai Line, the Kyoto City Subway and the first subway station built in the Ukyo Ward.
Located in the Ukyo Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station is the last stop on the Tozai Line, the Kyoto City Subway and the first subway station built in the Ukyo ward.
Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station, located in the Ukyo ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is the last stop on the Tozai Line of the Kyoto Municipal Subway and the first subway station built in Ukyo Ward.
sen.cmt: Tozai Line of the Kyoto Municipal Subwayとしました。

sen.j: 御池通と天神川通（国道162号）の天神川御池交差点下に設置された。
sen.e: The station lies under the Tenjingawa-oike crossing at the Oike-dori Street and the Tenjingawa-dori Street (National Route 162 Go).
The station lies under the Tenjingawa-oike crossing at Oike-dori Street and Tenjingawa-dori Street (National Route 162 Go).
The station lies under the Tenjingawa-oike crossing at Oike-dori Street and Tenjingawa-dori Street (National Route 162).

sen.j: 駅ナンバリングはT17。
sen.e: The number given to the station is T17.
The number given to the station is T17.
The number given to the station is T17.

sen.j: ステーションカラーはレモン色。
sen.e: A color given to the station is lemon color.
The color given to the station is lemon.
The color given to the station is lemon.

sen.j: 京都市中心部の多くの駅は、東西方向に走る路線は「交叉する南北の街路名」から、南北方向に走る路線（京都市営地下鉄烏丸線など）は「交叉する東西方向の街路名」から駅名をとっており、当駅の仮称も駅付近を走っている道路名の「天神川通」からとられていたが、地元要望にも配慮して最終決定された。
sen.e: Many of the station names in the central part of Kyoto City are given as follows: give 'a name of a street running north-south' to a station on the line running east-west which crosses the street or give 'a name of a street running east-west' to a station on the line running north-south (e.g., Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line) which crosses the street, and the station was temporarily named after 'Tenjingawa-dori' which is the name of a street running near the station, before the station name 'Uzumasa-tenjingawa' was finally selected by taking into account a local people's request.

Many of the station names in the central part of Kyoto City are given as follows: give 'a name of a street running north-south' to a station on the line running east-west that crosses the street or give 'a name of a street running east-west' to a station on the line running north-south (e.g., Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line) that crosses the street, and the station was temporarily named after 'Tenjingawa-dori' (which is the name of a street running near the station) before the station name 'Uzumasa-tenjingawa' was finally selected by taking into account a request by local people.

Many of the station names in the central part of Kyoto City are given under the following system: give 'a name of a street running north-south' to a station on the line running east-west that crosses the street or give 'a name of a street running east-west' to a station on the line running north-south (e.g., Kyoto Municipal Subway Karasuma Line) that crosses the street; accordingly, the station was temporarily named after 'Tenjingawa-dori' (which is the name of a street running near the station) before the station name 'Uzumasa-tenjingawa' was finally selected by taking into account a request by local people.

sen.j: 2007年2月に行われた駅名公募で、1位は、「天神川」が51%を、2位は、地域名の「太秦」などが12%だったのをその両者を併せた形となった。
sen.e: Among the public opinions for a station name gathered in February 2007, 'Tenjingawa' was selected as No.1which counted for 51% and 'Uzumasa' as No. 2 which counted for 12%, thereby combining the two for the station name.

Among the public opinions for a station name gathered in February 2007, 'Tenjingawa' was selected as number one, accounting for 51% and 'Uzumasa' as number two, accounting for 12%; consequently, the two were combined for the station name.

Among the public opinions for a station name gathered in February 2007, 'Tenjingawa' was selected as number one, accounting for 51% and 'Uzumasa' as number two, accounting for 12%; consequently, the two were combined for the station name.

sen.j: 地下1階にコンコース、地下3階に島式1面2線ホームがあり、ホームドアが設置される。
sen.e: There is a concourse on the first basement level and an island platform serving two tracks on the third basement level with platform doors.
There is a concourse on the first basement level and an island platform with platform doors serving two tracks on the third basement level.
There is a concourse on the first basement level and an island platform with platform doors serving two tracks on the third basement level.

sen.j: 浜大津行きの列車は、ほかの駅と異なり、ホーム西寄りに停車する。
sen.e: Unlike other stations, trains bound for Hamaotsu arrive at the station to the west of the platform.
Unlike other stations, trains bound for Hamaotsu arrive at the station to the west of the platform.
Unlike other stations, trains bound for Hamaotsu arrive at the station to the west of the platform.

sen.j: 改札前にはバスロケーションシステムがあり、バスの現在地を知ることが出来る。
sen.e: A bus location system is installed in front of a ticket gate to provide real-time locations of buses.
A bus locator system is installed in front of a ticket gate to provide real-time information on the locations of buses.
A bus locator system is installed in front of a ticket gate to provide real-time information on the locations of buses.

sen.j: 2008年1月の開業時には、一部の地上とコンコース階とを結ぶ階段が未供用で、出入り口が封鎖されていただけでなく地上バスターミナルも未完成で、一部を除き、路線バスは、三条通、天神川通などにある暫定的な停留所に停車していた。
sen.e: When the station opened in January 2008, part of the stairs connecting the ground and the concourse level was not placed in service, an entrance was blocked, some aboveground bus terminals were incomplete, and route buses thus stopped at temporary bus stops installed on the Sanjo-dori Street or the Tenjingawa-dori Street.

When the station opened in January 2008, part of the stairs connecting the ground and the concourse level was not placed in service, an entrance was blocked and some above-ground bus terminals were incomplete, so route buses stopped at temporary bus stops installed on either Sanjo-dori Street or Tenjingawa-dori Street.

When the station opened in January 2008, part of the stairs connecting the ground and the concourse level was not placed in service, an entrance was blocked and some above-ground bus terminals were incomplete, so route buses stopped at temporary bus stops installed on either Sanjo-dori Street or Tenjingawa-dori Street.

sen.j: 3月下旬には地上バスターミナルが一部供用を開した。
sen.e: Part of the aboveground bus terminals was placed in service in late March.
A portion of the above-ground bus terminal was put into service in late March.
A portion of the above-ground bus terminal was put into service in late March.

sen.j: コンコース階には、銀行ATMも設定予定。
sen.e: A bank automated teller machine will be installed on the concourse level.
A bank automated teller machine will be installed on the concourse level.
A bank automated teller machine will be installed on the concourse level.

sen.j: 日中は片方のホームに六地蔵行き、もう片方に浜大津行きを停車させるダイヤになっているが、どちらにどの方向の列車が停車するかは時間帯によってぶれがある。
sen.e: Trains bound for Rokujizo are set to arrive at one side of the platform and trains bound for Hamaotsu at another side during the day, but it depends on a time zone at which side of the platform respective trains arrive.

Trains bound for Rokujizo are set to arrive at one side of the platform and trains bound for Hamaotsu arrive at the other side during the day, but it depends on the time zone at which side of the platform the respective trains arrive.

Trains bound for Rokujizo are set to arrive at one side of the platform and trains bound for Hamaotsu arrive at the other side during the day, but it depends on the time zone at which side of the platform the respective trains arrive.

sen.j: 大日本印刷京都工場
sen.e: Kyoto (Uzumasa) Plant Dai Nippon Printing Co., Ltd.
Kyoto (Uzumasa) Plant Dai Nippon Printing Co., Ltd.
Kyoto (Uzumasa) Plant Dai Nippon Printing Co., Ltd.

sen.e: Kyoto Powertrain Plant, Mitsubishi Motors Corporation
Kyoto Powertrain Plant, Mitsubishi Motors Corporation
Kyoto Powertrain Plant, Mitsubishi Motors Corporation

sen.j: 京都外国語大学、京都外国語短期大学

Kyoto University of Foreign Studies Kyoto Junior College of Foreign Languages
Kyoto University of Foreign Studies, Kyoto Junior College of Foreign Languages

sen.j: 京都市上下水道局山ノ内浄水場
sen.e: Kyoto City Yamanouchi Purification Plant
Kyoto City Yamanouchi Purification Plant

sen.j: 天神川 (京都市)
sen.e: Tenjingawa River (Kyoto City)
Tenjingawa River (Kyoto City)
Tenjin-gawa River (Kyoto City)

sen.j: 京福電気鉄道京福電気鉄道嵐山本線・嵐電天神川駅
sen.e: Arashiyama Main Line, Keifuku Electric Railroad, Randen-Tenjingawa Station
Arashiyama Main Line, Keifuku Electric Railroad, Randen-Tenjingawa Station
Randen-Tenjingawa Station on the Arashiyama Main Line of the Keifuku Electric Railroad

sen.j: 当駅開業に伴い、2008年3月28日に京福嵐山線の蚕ノ社～山ノ内駅 (京都府)間に嵐電天神川駅が開業し、右京区の新たな拠点となる市街地再開発施設SANSA右京が駅地上部に建設され、京都市交通局本庁舎、右京区役所や福祉事務所、保健所などの移転している。
sen.e: As the station opened, the Randen-Tenjingawa Station opened between Kaikonoyashiro and Yamanouchi Station on the Arashiyama Main Line, Keifuku Electric Railroad on March 28, 2008, SANSA Ukyo was built on the aboveground of the station as a new base of the Ukyo Ward, into which Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau Government Office, Ukyo Ward Office, a welfare office, a healthcare center were moved.

As the station opened, the Randen-Tenjingawa Station opened between Kaikonoyashiro and Yamanouchi Station on the Arashiyama Main Line, Keifuku Electric Railroad on March 28, 2008; SANSA Ukyo was built on the aboveground of the station as a new base of the Ukyo ward, into which the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau Government Office, Ukyo Ward Office, a welfare office and a healthcare center were moved.

As the station opened, the Randen-Tenjingawa Station opened between Kaikonoyashiro and Yamanouchi stations (Kyoto Prefecture) on the Arashiyama Line of the Keifuku Electric Railroad on March 28, 2008; SANSA Ukyo was built on the aboveground of the station as a new base of Ukyo Ward, into which the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau Government Office, Ukyo Ward Office, a welfare office and a healthcare center were moved.
sen.cmt: the Arashiyama Line of the Keifuku Electric Railroadとしました。(Kyoto Prefecture)追加

sen.j: 地下の自転車等駐車場は2008年3月1日から供用開始。
sen.e: The underground bicycle parking area was placed in service on March 1, 2008.
The underground bicycle parking area was placed in service on March 1, 2008.
The underground bicycle parking area was placed in service on March 1, 2008.

sen.j: 京都市では、都市の再開発として地下鉄駅上に大型の施設がオープンした例として、北大路駅（地上に北大路ビブレ、地下に北大路バスターミナル）、山科駅（地上にラクトA～C、ホテル、大丸山科店、ラクト健康・文化館、山科社会教育総合センターなど）、醍醐駅 (京都府)（地上にアルプラザ・京都市醍醐中央図書館などが入居）が存在する。
sen.e: Examples of large-scale facilities built above a subway station as an urban redevelopment project in the Kyoto City include Kitaoji Station (Kitaoji VIVRE above the ground and the Kitaoji Bus Terminal under the ground), Yamashina Station (RACTO A, B, C, a hotel, DAIMARU YAMASHINA, RACTO-Kenko-Bunkakan (RACTO SPORTS PLAZA), and Yamashina Shakai-kyoiku-sogo Center (ASNY YAMASHINA) above the ground), and Daigo Station (Kyoto Prefecture)(AL PLAZA, and Daigo-chuo Library, Kyoto City above the ground).

Examples of large-scale facilities built above subway stations as urban redevelopment projects in Kyoto City include Kitaoji Station (Kitaoji VIVRE above-ground and the Kitaoji Bus Terminal underground), Yamashina Station (RACTO A, B, C, a hotel, DAIMARU YAMASHINA, RACTO-Kenko-Bunkakan (RACTO SPORTS PLAZA), and Yamashina Shakai-kyoiku-sogo Center (ASNY YAMASHINA) above-ground), and Daigo Station (Kyoto Prefecture)(AL PLAZA, and Daigo-chuo Library, Kyoto City above-ground).

Examples of large-scale facilities built above subway stations as urban redevelopment projects in Kyoto City include Kitaoji Station (Kitaoji VIVRE above-ground and the Kitaoji Bus Terminal underground), Yamashina Station (RACTO A, B, C, a hotel, DAIMARU YAMASHINA, RACTO-Kenko-Bunkakan (RACTO SPORTS PLAZA), and Yamashina Shakai-kyoiku-sogo Center (ASNY YAMASHINA) above-ground), and Daigo Station (Kyoto Prefecture)(AL PLAZA, and Daigo-chuo Library, Kyoto City above-ground).

sen.j: 太秦天神川駅も同様の例となり、大規模開発され公共施設が入居している。
sen.e: Likewise, Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station is also the example of the large-scale development, and public facilities reside in the building above the station.
Likewise, Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station is also the example of the large-scale development, and public facilities reside in the building above the station.
Likewise, Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station is also the example of the large-scale development, and public facilities reside in the building above the station.

sen.j: 当駅開業に伴い、京都市営バスは2路線を新設（70号系統・太秦天神川駅～桂駅、特8号系統・太秦天神川駅～山越中町）、既存6路線（8号、11号、27号、75号、80号、84号系統）を当駅を経由するよう経路変更または延長した。
sen.e: As the station opened, the Kyoto City Bus newly added two bus routes (Bus No. 70 between Uzumasa-tenjingawa-ekimae and Katsura Station; Rapid Bus No. 8 between Uzumasa-tenjingawa-ekimae and Yamagoe-nakacho) and changed or extended the existing six routes to go through the station (Bus Nos. 8, 11, 27, 75, 80, and 84).

As the station opened, the Kyoto City Bus newly added two bus routes (Bus No. 70 between Uzumasa-tenjingawa-ekimae and Katsura Station; Rapid Bus No. 8 between Uzumasa-tenjingawa-ekimae and Yamagoe-nakacho) and changed or extended the existing six routes to go through the station (bus nos. 8, 11, 27, 75, 80 and 84).

As the station opened, the Kyoto City Bus added two bus routes (Route No. 70 between Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station and Katsura Station; Rapid Route No. 8 between Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station and Yamagoe-nakacho) and changed or extended the existing six routes to go through the station (route nos. 8, 11, 27, 75, 80 and 84).

sen.e: The station opened as the last stop on January 16, 2008, when the Tozai Line was extended from the Nijo Station to the Uzumasa-tenjingawa Station.
